article.headline: Niagara 83, Loyola, Md. 79
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Charron Fisher had a game-high 31 points -- 21 in the second half -- as Niagara beat Loyola (Md.) 83-79 Tuesday night in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference action at the Gallagher Center. Niagara (14-7, 8-4 MAAC) also got 20 points from Tyrone Lewis, while Benson Egemonye added 15. Stanley Hodge netted 12 points while Fisher had a game-high nine rebounds. Loyola (13-11, 8-4) was led by Gerald Brown's 30 points. Brown scored 18 points in the second half. Marquis Sullivan and Brian Rudolph each scored 12 points. Lewis gave Niagara a 77-76 lead when he drove the lane and scored with 4:55 to play. Brown then sank two free throws with 2:29 to play to tie the game, 78-78. He added another free throw at 1:13 for a 79-78 lead. Fisher scored inside for an 80-79 lead. Fisher added two free throws with 25 seconds left before Egemonye rounded out the scoring with a free throw at 12.1 seconds to play. Loyola, which saw a six-game win streak snapped, did not make a field goal in the last 9:58 as its last 11 points came at the foul line.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
